title: Unable to sign in or track packages on FedEx.com using Mozilla Firefox
content:
For several weeks now I have been unable to sign in or track packages on FedEx.com. I have had to use Microsoft Edge to access FedEx.com. I never used to have this problem. I don't know what Mozilla did, but I wished it could be undone! I use a VPN, ExpressVPN, and thought this was the problem at first, but it is not. I turned off ExpressVPN and still cannot access FedEx.com. Same with using AT&T Broadband. I have tried cleaning my history/cookies and it has no affect whether I use ExpressVPN or AT&T Broadband. I went to FedEx.com on Mozilla and clicked the 'shield' and turned off Mozilla's Enhanced Tracking Feature. I still can not use FedEx.com.

I see no solution to this issue unless I can find some way to completely turn off your Enhanced Tracking software that you have added. It is ridiculous that I have to use Microsoft Edge every time I want to access FedEx.

What is the solution?
creator: Mitzee

title: firefox hangs whenever i open tumblr
content: afternoon, my keyboard is missing several keys so please bear with me. I have been having issues opening Tumblr in firefox for about a month now. I have been clearing my cache, i deleted all of my browser history and cookies to the beginning of time, and tumblr still hangs whenever i open it, going unresponsive until I forcequit from the task manager. sometimes, if I grab the scrollbar and get it away from the top of the page before it hangs, itll let me browse no issue, but most of the time it takes about 2 seconds to become hanging/unresponsive. I have not experienced this issue on any other site with the frequency that Tumblr experiences, and I cannot find any help desk information about a problem like this. I would really like to avoid moving to a different browser but its getting kind of insane how hard it is to live around it. if I have music/video going in the background, it will continue to play while Im forced to hang on tumblr, until I forcequit.

title: PDF and other files insisting on being downloaded, or opened in another firefox tab
content:
Example problems when handling PDFs, despite having "ask me what to do" or whatever set in preferences:

"Open in browser" results in a copy being saved to downloads folder, with random string filename.

"Open in [locally installed pdf viewer]" results in a copy being saved to downloads folder, with random string filename.

Quickbooks can't show receipt or document previews in the little pane. It insists on downloading it.

Gmail, Proton, and probably other email services can't render previews; same behaviour as qb.

How to fix, please? I don't even know how to properly articulate this problem, but it means half my browsing can't be done in firefox. Very frustrating.

content:

I'm probably still within that journey but the journey should terminate the moment I clicked unsubscribed.

title: Firefox no carga algunas páginas
content:
Hola He tenido que usar Edge porque Firefox no me permite cargar algunas páginas, inclusive las del soporte de Mozilla. Por ejemplo, esta página: https://support.mozilla.org/es/users/auth?next=%2Fes%2Fquestions%2Fnew%2Fdesktop%2Fform Si intento entrar, me dice:


Las cookies y almacenamiento local son obligatorios Las cookies siguen desactivadas

Por favor, activa las cookies y el almacenamiento local en tu navegador para acceder a Firefox Accounts. Si lo haces, se activarán funcionalidades como recordar tus datos entre sesiones.

Esto está pasando después de que hubiera un corte de luz y el ordenador se apagara incorrectamente. Al inicar Firefox después, ya ha dejado de funcionar con algunas páginas.

La de Mozilla no funciona, LinkedIn tampoco funciona...

¿Podría restablecer firefox de alguna manera para que vuelva a funcionar?

¿Debería deinstalarlo y borrar los perfiles actuales y volverlo a instalar o simplemente me creo otro perfil?

Si me pudiérais ayudar os lo agradecería.

Saludos Javier
creator: jgarcia1

title: Transitioning FF to a new computer
content:
After over a decade i am finally getting a new computer. It's in the mail. Any day now...

I wish to transfer my entire FF configuration to a new computer (when it arrives, up to 10 days from now-). Bookmarks, extensions, themes, look, feel, bells and whistles, all in one swoop.

I do have a sync account but i am honestly afraid to use it. I stopped syncing some time ago when i was trouble shooting and now i fear that if i turn sync on it might overwrite the configuration i am presently running with whatever was stored once some time ago.

Because i have done some colossally stupid things in the past that resulted in great data loss and many weeks of recovery, this time i think it best not to presume i will figure it out, but instead to ask you folks, the experts-

Many thanks, -Bruce

This is very unexpected behavior and very annoying. Please help!

title: Nový panel.
content: Dobrý den Vážení. Řešení je možná pro někoho jednoduché, ale já si s tím nevím rady. Pomozte prosím. Již několikátý den se mi po přepnutí (+) na nový panel, kde jsem měl nastaveny "zkratky" asi osmi nejnavštěvovanějších stránek, ihned načte Seznam.cz. Seznam.cz se nenačte pouze když nastavím do nového panelu "Prázdnou stránku", a nebo abych dosáhl původního záměru, musím po načtení Seznamu dát šipkou zpět a teprve potom se načtou "zkratky". Prohlížeč mám na pc pouze Firefox, win7, domovská stránka Centrum.cz. Děkuji.

title: non-printable characters in displayed text
content:
I have been using the coderanch.com website for more than a decade and most of the postings include listings of source code which I was (past tense) able to cut a paste into my own development environment. With the latest version (107) of Firefox this has broken, the document now gets numerous non-printable characters (decimal 160) for the leading indents of the code. I'm assuming they are being somehow substituted for the tab character.

Here's an example 

https://coderanch.com/t/755856/certification/Questions-errata-Sybex-OCP-Study

I went back to version 105 and the problem went away. Also Chrome does not have this problem.

Please fix soon as it is impacting my ability to help others on the coderanch site.

title: Something is preventing JavaScript from working on your computer.
content:
When I browse carsales.com.au and redbook.com.au I get the error message: 

We want to make sure it is actually you we are dealing with and not a robot.

Please click below to access the site. 

Why is this verification required? Something about your browser’s behavior has caught our attention.

There are various possible explanations for this: 

   You are browsing and clicking at a speed much faster than expected of a human being.    Something is preventing JavaScript from working on your computer.    There is a robot on the same network (IP 180.150.36.41) as you.

Having problems accessing the site? Contact support.

I have accessed these websites many times previously without problem. Other websites appear ok.

I'm on Windows 10 pc.

Many thanks.

creator: mmellough1

title: Firefox still running after exiting (Using File > Exit)
content:
For the last several weeks, the reliability of Firefox has went off a cliff following an auto-update. After a few hours of browsing, it gets to the point where the tabs load extremely slow (or not at all). When this happens, I exit and relaunch.

Previously, it would be nearly instantaneously where the windows would close and the firefox.exe process would cease within seconds. Now, it's taking upwards of 5-10 minutes for the process to stop AFTER the windows have closed and, during that time, it'll bring the system to a near crawl. Once the process finally closes though, everything is back to working fine.
creator: rdr.mail
